title: Greek Spanakopita Recipe
description: Spanakopita with spinach and feta cheese baked in phyllo pastry triangles until golden and crispy for a delicious savory Greek appetizer.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European Greek Greek Spanakopita 4.8 (345) 257 Reviews 40 Photos This spanakopita recipe for spinach and feta appetizer triangles came from a Greek family friend. These delicious savory treats can be made ahead of time and frozen before baking to golden and crisp. Submitted by MARY KESSLER Updated on April 14, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 40 40 40 40 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 27 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 27 servings ½ cup vegetable oil 2 large onions, chopped 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed, drained and squeezed dry 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 2 (4 ounce) packages feta cheese, crumbled 4 eggs, lightly beaten salt and ground black pepper to taste 1 ½ (16 ounce) packages phyllo dough ¾ pound butter, melted Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions; slowly cook and stir until softened. Stir in spinach, dill, and flour; cook until most moisture absorbed, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in feta cheese, eggs, salt, and black pepper. Separate 1 phyllo sheet from stack; place on a flat work surface. Evenly brush phyllo sheet with a light coating of butter. Place another phyllo sheet over buttered phyllo sheet; press phyllo sheets together. Cut layered phyllo sheets into long strips about 3-inches wide. (Keep remaining stack phyllo sheets covered with plastic wrap to keep from drying out.) Lay out 1 phyllo strip on work surface with 1 narrow end facing you. Place a heaping tablespoon of filling 1 inch from the narrow end. Fold the bottom right corner over the filling to the left edge to form a triangle. Fold the triangle up the strip, bringing the point at the bottom left up to rest along the left edge. Turn the lower left corner over to touch the right edge. Continue turning the triangle over in this manner until you reach the end of the phyllo. Repeat Steps 3 and 4 (buttering, stacking, pressing, cutting, filling, and folding) with remaining phyllo and filling. Place phyllo triangles on a large baking sheet; brush with remaining butter. (At this point, the pastries may be frozen. See Cook's Note.) Bake in the preheated oven until phyllo is golden brown and crisp, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Cook’s Note If you're making these ahead of time, proceed up to Step 5. Freeze triangles on a baking sheet until firm, then transfer to a freezer bag. To bake, arrange pastries on a lightly greased or parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake until phyllo is golden brown and filling is hot; start checking for doneness after 1 hour. I Made It Print 406 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Greek Spanakopita 01 of 40 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 40 Photo by  Samia Ann El-Moslimany 02/01/2024 This was a great recipe I adapted to the ingredients and leftovers I had. I used leftover creamed spinach, mushrooms, and onions. I added a little fresh spinach that I baked (to reduce moisture instead of squeezing out all the spinach-flavored juice) and I added some Mexican sour cream. 03 of 40 Photo by  RegnadKcin 04/30/2023 Excellent recipe and instructions! Turned out wonderfully! 04 of 40 Photo by  jsobczak324 06/05/2021 05 of 40 Photo by  Rose Knows 10/18/2020 06 of 40 Photo by  STEPHCF 09/07/2020 07 of 40 Photo by  Mikhailnmc 05/25/2020 08 of 40 Photo by  katb 02/26/2020 These are absolutely delicious!! 09 of 40 Photo by  karolyn 12/05/2019 10 of 40 Photo by  pnewman17 11/12/2019 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Speedy Spanikopita 2 Ratings Sausage Spanakopita Triangles 2 Ratings Spinach Dip in Pumpernickel 31 Ratings Pumpernickel Spinach Dip 46 Ratings Original Ranch Spinach Dip 27 Ratings No Bake Pizza Appetizer 19 Ratings Facemeltingly-Good Spinach Dip 9 Ratings Ali's Greek Tortellini Salad 277 Ratings Greek-Style Shrimp Salad on a Bed of Baby Spinach 27 Ratings Easy Greek Yogurt Cucumber Sauce 170 Ratings Greek Stuffed Chicken Breasts 18 Ratings Amazing Artichoke and Spinach Dip 31 Ratings Spinach Artichoke Dip from Reynolds Wrap® 2 Ratings Sour Cream Mushroom Dip 21 Ratings Loaded Greek Burgers 28 Ratings Air Fryer Spinach and Feta Casserole 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: MARY KESSLER
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Heat vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions; slowly cook and stir until softened. Stir in spinach, dill, and flour; cook until most moisture absorbed, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in feta cheese, eggs, salt, and black pepper.;Separate 1 phyllo sheet from stack; place on a flat work surface. Evenly brush phyllo sheet with a light coating of butter. Place another phyllo sheet over buttered phyllo sheet; press phyllo sheets together. Cut layered phyllo sheets into long strips about 3-inches wide. Place a heaping tablespoon of filling 1 inch from the narrow end. Fold the bottom right corner over the filling to the left edge to form a triangle. Fold the triangle up the strip, bringing the point at the bottom left up to rest along the left edge. Turn the lower left corner over to touch the right edge. Continue turning the triangle over in this manner until you reach the end of the phyllo. Repeat Steps 3 and 4 (buttering, stacking, pressing, cutting, filling, and folding) with remaining phyllo and filling.;Place phyllo triangles on a large baking sheet; brush with remaining butter. (At this point, the pastries may be frozen. See Cook's Note.);Bake in the preheated oven until phyllo is golden brown and crisp, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
